TRENTON , N.J. - Private lawyers hired by Gov. Chris Christie 's office after the George Washington Bridge scandal erupted are on pace to bill taxpayers roughly $ 3 million for their work , and it appears well over half that tab is being incurred for events unrelated to whatever led to the lane closures in Fort Lee .
